basilica-of-our-lady-of-guadalupe-2.title: Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe
basilica-of-our-lady-of-guadalupe-2.description: The Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe is located in the north of Mexico City. The shrine was built near the hill of Tepeyac where Our Lady of Guadalupe is believed to have appeared to Saint Juan Diego Cuauhtlatoatzin. The new Basilica houses the original tilma (or cloak) of Juan Diego, which holds the image of Our Lady of Guadalupe. It is one of the most important pilgrimage sites of Catholicism, the basilica is visited by several million people every year, especially around December 12, Our Lady of Guadalupe's Feast day.

catedral-metropolitana.title: Catedral Metropolitana
catedral-metropolitana.description: The Metropolitan Cathedral is the largest cathedral in the Americas. It is situated atop the former Aztec sacred precinct near the Templo Mayor on the northern side of the Plaza de la Constitución in Downtown Mexico City. The cathedral was built in sections from 1573 to 1813. It is considered a World Heritage Site by UNESCO as it is within the historic center of Mexico City.

catedral-metropolitana-coro.title: Catedral Metropolitana Coro
catedral-metropolitana-coro.description: The Metropolitan Cathedral is the largest cathedral in the Americas. It is situated atop the former Aztec sacred precinct near the Templo Mayor on the northern side of the Plaza de la Constitución in Downtown Mexico City. The cathedral was built in sections from 1573 to 1813. It is considered a World Heritage Site by UNESCO as it is within the historic center of Mexico City.

our-lady-of-guadalupe.title: Our Lady of Guadalupe
our-lady-of-guadalupe.description: The Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe is located in the north of Mexico City. The shrine was built near the hill of Tepeyac where Our Lady of Guadalupe is believed to have appeared to Saint Juan Diego Cuauhtlatoatzin. The new Basilica houses the original tilma (or cloak) of Juan Diego, which holds the image of Our Lady of Guadalupe. It is one of the most important pilgrimage sites of Catholicism, the basilica is visited by several million people every year, especially around December 12, Our Lady of Guadalupe's Feast day.

catedral-metropolitana-exterior.description: The Metropolitan Cathedral is the largest cathedral in the Americas. It is situated atop the former Aztec sacred precinct near the Templo Mayor on the northern side of the Plaza de la Constitución in Downtown Mexico City. The cathedral was built in sections from 1573 to 1813. It is considered a World Heritage Site by UNESCO as it is within the historic center of Mexico City.

our-lady-of-guadalupe-altar.title: Our Lady of Guadalupe Altar
our-lady-of-guadalupe-altar.description: The Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe is located in the north of Mexico City. The shrine was built near the hill of Tepeyac where Our Lady of Guadalupe is believed to have appeared to Saint Juan Diego Cuauhtlatoatzin. The new Basilica houses the original tilma (or cloak) of Juan Diego, which holds the image of Our Lady of Guadalupe. It is one of the most important pilgrimage sites of Catholicism, the basilica is visited by several million people every year, especially around December 12, Our Lady of Guadalupe's Feast day.

capilla-del-carmen.title: Capilla del Carmen
capilla-del-carmen.description: Capilla del Carmen is a historical monument of significance for the city of Ixmiquilpan, Hidalgo. It was completed on December 8, 1772. It is considered an architectural jewel due to its pink quarry facade and carved wood altar.

capilla-del-santuario.title: Capilla del Santuario
capilla-del-santuario.description: The chapel is located in the Hacienda Cabaña de Negros, it was built in the second decade of the XVII century.

templo-inconcluso.title: Templo Inconcluso
templo-inconcluso.description: The Unfinished Temple of the Precious Blood, is one of the main tourist and cultural attractions of Mascota, Jalisco. This Temple was built in the late nineteenth century.

templo-de-la-valenciana-guanajuato.title: Templo de la Valenciana - Guanajuato
templo-de-la-valenciana-guanajuato.description: The La Valenciana or San Cayetano church is an 18th century Mexican Churrigueresque church built at the opening of the La Valenciana mine. The church is noted for use of gold leaf, especially the main altarpieces which are completely covered in the metal. The church is also a site of the Festival Internacional Cervantino. Construction of the church was begun in 1775 and completed in 1788.

catedral-de-merida-1.title: Catedral de Merida
catedral-de-merida-1.description: The Mérida Cathedral in Mérida, Yucatán, Mexico, is one of the oldest cathedrals in the Americas. it was built during the 16th century

san-bernardino-de-siena-xochimilco.title: San Bernardino de Siena Xochimilco
san-bernardino-de-siena-xochimilco.description: Iglesia y Convento de San Bernardino de Siena Xochimilco was built in the 16th century over a former pre Hispanic temple as part of the evangelization efforts after the Spanish conquest the Aztec Empire.

san-martin-caballero.title: San Martín Caballero
san-martin-caballero.description: The Capilla de San Martín Caballero dates from the colonial period (16th and 17th centuries). It is located in the borough Milpa Alta, Mexico City.

parroquia-de-nuestra-senora-de-guadalupe.title: Parroquia de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, Tuxtla Gutiérrez
parroquia-de-nuestra-senora-de-guadalupe.description: The Parish of Our Lady of Guadalupe is located in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas , Mexico . It is an important pilgrimage center that attracts thousands of people.

jesus-de-nazareth-de-tepetates.title: Jesús de Nazareth de Tepetates
jesus-de-nazareth-de-tepetates.description: The Parish of Jesus of Nazareth of Tepetates was built in the XVI century during the conquest of Cuauhnáhuac. Located in the old neighborhood of Tecoac, the heart of the city of Cuernavaca, today called Tepetates.

san-nicolas-tolentino.title: San Nicolás Tolentino
san-nicolas-tolentino.description: The Templo y exconvento de San Nicolás de Tolentino is located in the city of Actopan, Hidalgo. Its construction began in 1548 and it is one of the most important historical monuments in the state of Hidalgo. In 1933 it was declared a Historical and Artistic Monument of the Nation.

templo-de-la-compania.title: Templo de la Compañía
templo-de-la-compania.description: The Iglesia de la Compañía de Jesús, in Guanajuato, is one of the biggest churches that was built by the Jesuit Society during the time of New Spain. Work began in 1746 and was completed in 1765.

senor-de-la-misericordia.title: Señor de la Misericordia
senor-de-la-misericordia.description: The Temple of Señor de la Misericordia de Jalpa de Canovas was completed in 1925, highlighted by neo-Gothic style. It is located in the town of Purísima del Rincón in the state of Guanajuato.

sagrado-corazon-de-jesus.title: Sagrado Corazón de Jesús
sagrado-corazon-de-jesus.description: The Expiatory Sanctuary of the Sacred Heart of Jesus is of neo Gothic design, based on the old European medieval cathedrals, the construction began in 1921. It is a major tourist attraction of the city of Leon, it is one of the most beautiful temples in the country.

santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe.title: Santuario de Santa María de Guadalupe
santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe.description: The Santuario de Santa Maria de Guadalupe is a catholic church & pilgrimage site, it houses a cloak with the image of the Virgin of Guadalupe.

capilla-del-santisimo-sacramento-basilic.title: Capilla del Santísimo Sacramento - Basílica de Santa María de Guadalupe
capilla-del-santisimo-sacramento-basilic.description: The Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe is located in the north of Mexico City. The shrine was built near the hill of Tepeyac where Our Lady of Guadalupe is believed to have appeared to Saint Juan Diego Cuauhtlatoatzin. The new Basilica houses the original tilma (or cloak) of Juan Diego, which holds the image of Our Lady of Guadalupe. It is one of the most important pilgrimage sites of Catholicism, the basilica is visited by several million people every year, especially around December 12, Our Lady of Guadalupe's Feast day.

capilla-de-san-jose-basilica-de-santa-ma.title: Capilla de San José - Basílica de Santa María de Guadalupe
capilla-de-san-jose-basilica-de-santa-ma.description: The Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe is located in the north of Mexico City. The shrine was built near the hill of Tepeyac where Our Lady of Guadalupe is believed to have appeared to Saint Juan Diego Cuauhtlatoatzin. The new Basilica houses the original tilma (or cloak) of Juan Diego, which holds the image of Our Lady of Guadalupe. It is one of the most important pilgrimage sites of Catholicism, the basilica is visited by several million people every year, especially around December 12, Our Lady of Guadalupe's Feast day.

basilica-of-our-lady-of-guadalupe-3.title: Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe
basilica-of-our-lady-of-guadalupe-3.description: The Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe is located in the north of Mexico City. The shrine was built near the hill of Tepeyac where Our Lady of Guadalupe is believed to have appeared to Saint Juan Diego Cuauhtlatoatzin. The new Basilica houses the original tilma (or cloak) of Juan Diego, which holds the image of Our Lady of Guadalupe. It is one of the most important pilgrimage sites of Catholicism, the basilica is visited by several million people every year, especially around December 12, Our Lady of Guadalupe's Feast day.

santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-1.title: Santuario de Santa María de Guadalupe
santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-1.description: El Santuario de Santa Maria de Guadalupe es una iglesia católica y lugar de peregrinación que alberga el manto con la imagen de la Virgen de Guadalupe.

basilica-of-our-lady-of-guadalupe-first-.title: Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe (First Floor)
basilica-of-our-lady-of-guadalupe-first-.description: The Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe is located in the north of Mexico City. The shrine was built near the hill of Tepeyac where Our Lady of Guadalupe is believed to have appeared to Saint Juan Diego Cuauhtlatoatzin. The new Basilica houses the original tilma (or cloak) of Juan Diego, which holds the image of Our Lady of Guadalupe. It is one of the most important pilgrimage sites of Catholicism, the basilica is visited by several million people every year, especially around December 12, Our Lady of Guadalupe's Feast day.

templo-expiatorio-a-cristo-rey-antigua-b.title: Templo Expiatorio a Cristo Rey (Antigua Basílica de Guadalupe)
templo-expiatorio-a-cristo-rey-antigua-b.description: The Templo Expiatorio a Cristo Rey was the first structure of the old basilica. Its construction begun in 1695 and it was not finished until 1709.

capilla-del-sagrario-templo-expiatorio-a.title: Capilla del Sagrario - Templo Expiatorio a Cristo Rey
capilla-del-sagrario-templo-expiatorio-a.description: The Templo Expiatorio a Cristo Rey was the first structure of the old basilica. Its construction begun in 1695 and it was not finished until 1709.

antigua-parroquia-de-indios-2.title: Antigua Parroquia de Indios
antigua-parroquia-de-indios-2.description: Antigua Parroquia de Indios is considered that this is the place where the Blessed Virgin of Guadalupe gave flowers to San Juan Diego. By petition of Fran Custom Archbishop Juan de Zumarraga in 1531, Juan Diego, Juan Bernardino and others, initiated the construction of the first chapel.At this time, the news about the apparitions and miracles spread throughout the region and this place started to attend a lot of people to admire and venerate the Virgin of Guadalupe.San Juan Diego lived here his last 17 years watching over the Guadalupana miraculous tilma. According to the chroniclers, in May 1554, Juan Bernardino was buried right here; and in June 1548, the Indian Juan Diego. In 1556 Fray Alonso de Montufar, Archbishop of Mexico, was commissioned to carefully revamped the chaptel.It kept the banner of the Virgin from 1853 to1896. This was the banner that Don Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, took from the Sanctuary of Atotonilco for calling the independence of Mexico.Currently at the east side of the Capilla de Indios, there is a cross that marks the spot where it is believed that San Juan Diego lived. On the north side or rear of the chapel, it is the famous casahuate tree, which also indicates the place where the Virgin appeared to St. Juan Diego.These Holy Shrines are now located in the sacristy of the Capilla de Indios. Some of the original parts can be seen.In this chapel, on April 27th, 1709, the Guadalupana Tilman was moved in to the new Basilica temple; nos known as Templo Expiatorio.

santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-4.title: Santuario de Santa María de Guadalupe
santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-4.description: The Santuario de Santa Maria de Guadalupe is a catholic church & pilgrimage site, it houses a cloak with the image of the Virgin of Guadalupe.

antigua-parroquia-de-indios.title: Antigua Parroquia de Indios
antigua-parroquia-de-indios.description: Antigua Parroquia de Indios is considered that this is the place where the Blessed Virgin of Guadalupe gave flowers to San Juan Diego. By petition of Fran Custom Archbishop Juan de Zumarraga in 1531, Juan Diego, Juan Bernardino and others, initiated the construction of the first chapel.At this time, the news about the apparitions and miracles spread throughout the region and this place started to attend a lot of people to admire and venerate the Virgin of Guadalupe.San Juan Diego lived here his last 17 years watching over the Guadalupana miraculous tilma. According to the chroniclers, in May 1554, Juan Bernardino was buried right here; and in June 1548, the Indian Juan Diego. In 1556 Fray Alonso de Montufar, Archbishop of Mexico, was commissioned to carefully revamped the chaptel.It kept the banner of the Virgin from 1853 to1896. This was the banner that Don Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, took from the Sanctuary of Atotonilco for calling the independence of Mexico.Currently at the east side of the Capilla de Indios, there is a cross that marks the spot where it is believed that San Juan Diego lived. On the north side or rear of the chapel, it is the famous casahuate tree, which also indicates the place where the Virgin appeared to St. Juan Diego.These Holy Shrines are now located in the sacristy of the Capilla de Indios. Some of the original parts can be seen.In this chapel, on April 27th, 1709, the Guadalupana Tilman was moved in to the new Basilica temple; nos known as Templo Expiatorio.

antigua-parroquia-de-indios-restos-de-sa.title: Antigua Parroquia de Indios (Restos de San Juan Diego)
antigua-parroquia-de-indios-restos-de-sa.description: Antigua Parroquia de Indios is considered that this is the place where the Blessed Virgin of Guadalupe gave flowers to San Juan Diego. By petition of Fran Custom Archbishop Juan de Zumarraga in 1531, Juan Diego, Juan Bernardino and others, initiated the construction of the first chapel.At this time, the news about the apparitions and miracles spread throughout the region and this place started to attend a lot of people to admire and venerate the Virgin of Guadalupe.San Juan Diego lived here his last 17 years watching over the Guadalupana miraculous tilma. According to the chroniclers, in May 1554, Juan Bernardino was buried right here; and in June 1548, the Indian Juan Diego. In 1556 Fray Alonso de Montufar, Archbishop of Mexico, was commissioned to carefully revamped the chaptel.It kept the banner of the Virgin from 1853 to1896. This was the banner that Don Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, took from the Sanctuary of Atotonilco for calling the independence of Mexico.Currently at the east side of the Capilla de Indios, there is a cross that marks the spot where it is believed that San Juan Diego lived. On the north side or rear of the chapel, it is the famous casahuate tree, which also indicates the place where the Virgin appeared to St. Juan Diego.These Holy Shrines are now located in the sacristy of the Capilla de Indios. Some of the original parts can be seen.In this chapel, on April 27th, 1709, the Guadalupana Tilman was moved in to the new Basilica temple; nos known as Templo Expiatorio.

capilla-del-pocito-1.title: Capilla del Pocito
capilla-del-pocito-1.description: According to historians, the Capilla del Pocito shows the site of the fourth Guadalupe apparition to St. Juan Diego, from same location there was a wellspring, attributing curative properties. This temple was built given the great affluence and it was finished in 1791, designed by the Arq. Francisco Guerrero y Torres.Today into one of its outer walls holds a plaque of the Municipality of Guadalupe Hidalgo at the first Centenary of Consummation of Independence taking place on September 22th, 1921, where it is read that here passed the insurgent Jose Ma. Morelos y Pavon on December 22th, 1815, when he was on his way to the torture in San Cristobal Ecatepec. Inside there are four altarpieces of the apparitions of the Virgin of Guadalupe. At the west entrance, at the top it is the coat of arms of the Village of Guadalupe. This chapel is one of the most precious jewels of Mexican baroque art.Religious ceremonies are celebrate in here for those who enjoy an atmosphere full of art and tradition.

santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-2.title: Santuario de Santa María de Guadalupe
santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-2.description: The Santuario de Santa Maria de Guadalupe is a catholic church & pilgrimage site, it houses a cloak with the image of the Virgin of Guadalupe.

capilla-del-cerrito.title: Capilla del Cerrito
capilla-del-cerrito.description: La Capilla del Cerrito is a chapel located on the top of Tepeyac, in northern Mexico City, at the place where the Virgin of Guadalupe appeared to Juan Diego. It was the first chapel dedicated to St. Maria de Guadalupe.

santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-5.title: Santuario de Santa María de Guadalupe
santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-5.description: The Santuario de Santa Maria de Guadalupe is a catholic church & pilgrimage site, it houses a cloak with the image of the Virgin of Guadalupe.

parroquia-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-ca.title: Parroquia de Santa Maria de Guadalupe Capuchinas
parroquia-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-ca.description: Parroquia Capuchinas was completed in 1787, at the time of Archbishop Don Alonso Nuñez de Haro and Peralta. It was originally Convent and Church of the Capuchinas religious sisters.There, the sacred image of Our. Sra. de Guadalupe found shelter; the first time from July 10th to December 10th, 1791, and the second time from February 23th to October 2nd, 1888. The property was dangerously leaning, so it was forced to close from 1970 to 1996 for a serious reconstruction. Currently inside, the central altar is majestically highlighted with the image of the Guadalupana Holy Family painted on canvas with acrylic paints in a circle with 4 meters in diameter made in 1998. Its authors P. Fray Gabriel Chávez de Mora. and Arq. Jaime Domínguez Montes, upon request of Cango. Armando F. Colin.Santa Maria de Guadalupe, Capuchinas, is in charge for the custody the temples of Pocito, de Indios, Baptistery and the Oaths.

santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-3.title: Santuario de Santa María de Guadalupe
santuario-de-santa-maria-de-guadalupe-3.description: The Santuario de Santa Maria de Guadalupe is a catholic church & pilgrimage site, it houses a cloak with the image of the Virgin of Guadalupe.

capilla-del-pocito.title: Capilla del Pocito
capilla-del-pocito.description: According to historians, the Capilla del Pocito shows the site of the fourth Guadalupe apparition to St. Juan Diego, from same location there was a wellspring, attributing curative properties. This temple was built given the great affluence and it was finished in 1791, designed by the Arq. Francisco Guerrero y Torres.Today into one of its outer walls holds a plaque of the Municipality of Guadalupe Hidalgo at the first Centenary of Consummation of Independence taking place on September 22th, 1921, where it is read that here passed the insurgent Jose Ma. Morelos y Pavon on December 22th, 1815, when he was on his way to the torture in San Cristobal Ecatepec. Inside there are four altarpieces of the apparitions of the Virgin of Guadalupe. At the west entrance, at the top it is the coat of arms of the Village of Guadalupe. This chapel is one of the most precious jewels of Mexican baroque art.Religious ceremonies are celebrate in here for those who enjoy an atmosphere full of art and tradition.

bautisterio-basilica-de-guadalupe.title: Bautisterio Basílica de Guadalupe
bautisterio-basilica-de-guadalupe.description: Bautisterio Basílica de Guadalupe is located in the back of the Basilica of Guadalupe, near the atrial door Av. Mysteries. Right next to the stairs of Cerrito del Tepeyac. This is the best place to offered and to entrust newborns children under the protection of the Mother of all Mexicans: Our Sacred Virgin Maria de Guadalupe, through the sacrament of Baptism.

el-senor-del-veneno-cristo-negro-catedra.title: El Señor del Veneno, Cristo Negro - Catedral Metropolitana de la Ciudad de México
el-senor-del-veneno-cristo-negro-catedra.description: The Metropolitan Cathedral is the largest cathedral in the Americas. It is situated atop the former Aztec sacred precinct near the Templo Mayor on the northern side of the Plaza de la Constitución in Downtown Mexico City. The cathedral was built in sections from 1573 to 1813. It is considered a World Heritage Site by UNESCO as it is within the historic center of Mexico City.

sacristia-mayor-de-la-catedral-metropoli.title: Sacristía Mayor de la Catedral Metropolitana de la Ciudad de México
sacristia-mayor-de-la-catedral-metropoli.description: The Metropolitan Cathedral is the largest cathedral in the Americas. It is situated atop the former Aztec sacred precinct near the Templo Mayor on the northern side of the Plaza de la Constitución in Downtown Mexico City. The cathedral was built in sections from 1573 to 1813. It is considered a World Heritage Site by UNESCO as it is within the historic center of Mexico City.

cripta-de-los-arzobispos-catedral-metrop.title: Cripta de los Arzobispos - Catedral Metropolitana de la Ciudad de México
cripta-de-los-arzobispos-catedral-metrop.description: The Metropolitan Cathedral is the largest cathedral in the Americas. It is situated atop the former Aztec sacred precinct near the Templo Mayor on the northern side of the Plaza de la Constitución in Downtown Mexico City. The cathedral was built in sections from 1573 to 1813. It is considered a World Heritage Site by UNESCO as it is within the historic center of Mexico City.

archaeological-foundations-under-the-mex.title: Archaeological foundations under the Mexico City Metropolitan Cathedral

mexico-city-metropolitan-cathedrals-cent.title: Mexico City Metropolitan Cathedral's Central Dome

clockwork-mechanism-of-mexico-city-metro.title: Clockwork Mechanism of Mexico City Metropolitan Cathedral

salon-guadalupano-curia-catedral-metropo.title: Salón Guadalupano, Curia - Catedral Metropolitana de la Ciudad de México
salon-guadalupano-curia-catedral-metropo.description: The Metropolitan Cathedral is the largest cathedral in the Americas. It is situated atop the former Aztec sacred precinct near the Templo Mayor on the northern side of the Plaza de la Constitución in Downtown Mexico City. The cathedral was built in sections from 1573 to 1813. It is considered a World Heritage Site by UNESCO as it is within the historic center of Mexico City.

sagrario-de-la-catedral-asuncion-ciudad-.title: Sagrario de la Catedral Asunción Ciudad de México
sagrario-de-la-catedral-asuncion-ciudad-.description: This Sagrario de la Catedral Asunción Ciudad de México building was built between 1749 and 1768 by the Andalusian architect Lorenzo Rodriguez. It is the parish of the Metropolitan Cathedral, attached to it.

capilla-de-las-animas-de-la-catedral-met.title: Capilla de las Ánimas de la Catedral Metropolitana Ciudad de México
capilla-de-las-animas-de-la-catedral-met.description: The Capilla de las Ánimas is a small Catholic church of the eighteenth century. Its style is baroque and it forms part of the Metropolitan Cathedral in the Historic center of Mexico City .

catedral-de-san-marcos-tuxtla-gutierrez.title: Catedral de San Marcos, Tuxtla Gutiérrez
catedral-de-san-marcos-tuxtla-gutierrez.description: The Cathedral of San Marcos is an ex-monastery located in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas , Mexico . In 1990 the Pope John Paul II visited the State of Chiapas , in particular the Cathedral of San Marcos.

templo-de-santo-domingo-san-cristobal-de.title: Templo de Santo Domingo, San Cristobal de las Casas
templo-de-santo-domingo-san-cristobal-de.description: Built by the Dominican Friars in 1546, the Iglesia Ex Convento de Santo Domingo is one of the most important Baroque works in the region. Its facade, fully restored in 2006, is considered one of the most richly ornamented representations of the colonial Baroque style in all of Latin America.

catedral-san-cristobal-de-las-casas.title: Catedral San Cristobal de las Casas
catedral-san-cristobal-de-las-casas.description: The San Cristobal de las Casas Cathedral was built in 1528 and remodeled in the early eighteenth century, is the most representative monument of the city. The interior retains interesting pieces of art, including two beautiful wood altarpieces in salomonic baroque.

iglesia-de-nuestra-senora-de-guadalupe-s.title: Iglesia de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, San Cristobal de las Casas
iglesia-de-nuestra-senora-de-guadalupe-s.description: The Iglesia del Cerro de Guadalupe was built on top of the Cerro (hill) de Guadalupe in 1834. From the entrance of the church 79 steps are ascended to arrive at the top, rewarded with an unparalleled panoramic view of the city San Cristobal de las Casas.

iglesia-del-cerro-de-san-cristobal-de-la.title: Iglesia del Cerro de San Cristobal de las Casas
iglesia-del-cerro-de-san-cristobal-de-la.description: This temple was built by Friar Juan de Ordoñez in the late eighteenth century. Every 25 of July, the hill lights up with fireworks, music, food, visitors and worshipers who venerate the image of this saint.

templo-del-carmen-san-cristobal-de-las-c.title: Templo del Carmen San Cristobal de las Casas
templo-del-carmen-san-cristobal-de-las-c.description: The original construction dated in the century XVI. It is located in the town of San Cristobal de las Casas, considered a Magic Town.

catedral-de-nuestra-senora-de-la-asuncio.title: Catedral de Nuestra Señora de la Asunción y Exconvento de Cuernavaca
catedral-de-nuestra-senora-de-la-asuncio.description: The Cathedral of the Assumption of Mary of Cuernavaca was declared a World Heritage Site by Unesco in 1994. The church and its surrounding monastery is from the early 16th century, which makes it one of the oldest cathedrals in the country.

basilica-colegiata-de-nuestra-senora-de-.title: Basílica Colegiata de Nuestra Señora de Guanajuato
basilica-colegiata-de-nuestra-senora-de-.description: Basílica Colegiata de Nuestra Señora de Guanajuato was a parish in 1957 but it was converted into Basilica. Its construction began in 1771 and concluded in 1796.

iglesia-de-san-mateo-huichapan.title: Iglesia de San Mateo, Huichapan
iglesia-de-san-mateo-huichapan.description: This place was built in 1753-1763 under the direction of the craftsman Antonio Simon. It is a historical monument of the city of Huichapan , Hidalgo.

santuario-de-nuestra-senora-de-guadalupe.title: Santuario de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, Puerto Vallarta
santuario-de-nuestra-senora-de-guadalupe.description: The Church of Our Lady of Guadalupe is located in Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco. The church has been called "one of the most endearing" of the city's landmarks. The design elements are neoclassical, baroque and renaissance.

catedral-de-san-jose-de-tula.title: Catedral de San José de Tula
catedral-de-san-jose-de-tula.description: The Cathedral was built by the order of the Franciscans in the sixteenth century, from 1543 to 1554. It was one of the first convents built in Mexico. It is located in the city of Tula de Allende, Hidalgo.

iglesia-de-santo-domingo-de-la-ciudad-de.title: Iglesia de Santo Domingo de la Ciudad de México
iglesia-de-santo-domingo-de-la-ciudad-de.description: The Church of Santo Domingo is a Baroque church of the eighteenth century and is all that remains of what was the important convent of the Order of Santo Domingo in Mexico City . It is located in the historic city center. Is also here where the remains of one of the sons of Moctezuma II are buried. The general style of this building is considered to be Mexican Baroque.

catedral-basilica-metropolitana-de-la-ma.title: Catedral Basílica Metropolitana de la Madre Santísima de la Luz
catedral-basilica-metropolitana-de-la-ma.description: The main church is called the Basilica Cathedral of Our Holy Mother of the Light and is the seat of the Archdiocese of Leon. The construction of the church was begun in 1746 by the Jesuits and is a combination of Baroque and Neo Classic architectural styles

templo-de-san-jose-el-calvario-cuernavac.title: Templo de San José "El Calvario", Cuernavaca
templo-de-san-jose-el-calvario-cuernavac.description: Templo de San José el Calvario is a set of two religious buildings in downtown Cuernavaca city. It was built in the early XX century based in a romantic style.

templo-de-la-merced-de-mellado-mineral-d.title: Templo de la Merced de Mellado Mineral de Rayas, Guanajuato
templo-de-la-merced-de-mellado-mineral-d.description: The Templo de la Merced de Mellado Mineral de Rayas was built in the mid XVIII century. It is located in the northern part of the city of Guanajuato where the Rayas Mine was.

capilla-de-la-virgen-de-guadalupe-huicha.title: Capilla de la Vírgen de Guadalupe, Huichapan
capilla-de-la-virgen-de-guadalupe-huicha.description: The chapel of the Virgin of Guadalupe was built by the Franciscans in 1692. The chapel is located in the city of Huichapan in the state of Hidalgo.

capilla-del-tercer-orden-huichapan.title: Capilla del Tercer Orden, Huichapan
capilla-del-tercer-orden-huichapan.description: The Capilla del Tercer Orden was built in 1563. This building is located in Huichapan, Hidalgo.

parroquia-de-la-preciosa-sangre-de-crist.title: Parroquia de la Preciosa Sangre de Cristo y Convento
parroquia-de-la-preciosa-sangre-de-crist.description: The Parroquia de la Preciosa Sangre de Cristo dates from the XVII century. It is located in the town of Pachuquilla , Hidalgo.

iglesia-de-los-santos-reyes-interiores-m.title: Iglesia de los Santos Reyes (interiores)- Meztitlán
iglesia-de-los-santos-reyes-interiores-m.description: The Templo and ex-Convento de los Santos Reyes de Metztitlán is one of the main attractions of Metztitlán, is built in the center of town and within the Biosphere Reserve of Barranca de Metztitlán. It was founded in the sixteenth century, around 1536 and 1560 .

parroquia-de-san-pablo-oztotepec.title: Parroquia de San Pablo Oztotepec
parroquia-de-san-pablo-oztotepec.description: The church of St. Paul is located in Oztotepec, Mexico. It is a magnificent Franciscan building, its origin dating from the twelfth century. Its interior is decorated with baroque art.

exconvento-y-parroquia-de-nuestra-senora.title: Exconvento y Parroquia de Nuestra Señora de la Asunción en Milpa Alta
exconvento-y-parroquia-de-nuestra-senora.description: The Exconvento y Parroquia de Nuestra Señora de la Asunción was built between 1585 and 1630. The interior is decorated with blue Talavera from Puebla and the exterior with colonial and neo-classical art works.

capilla-de-nuestra-senora-de-guadalupe-s.title: Capilla de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, San Pedro Atocpan
capilla-de-nuestra-senora-de-guadalupe-s.description: The Capilla de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe dates from the colonial period (16th and 17th centuries). It is located in the borough Milpa Alta, Mexico City.

parroquia-y-capilla-de-san-pedro-atocpan.title: Parroquia y Capilla de San Pedro Atocpan - Milpa Alta
parroquia-y-capilla-de-san-pedro-atocpan.description: The Parish of San Pedro Apostol is a Franciscan church that was declared a national monument in 1933. Located in the town of San Pedro Atocpan, Milpa Alta.

convento-y-parroquia-de-santa-ana-tlacot.title: Convento y Parroquia de Santa Ana Tlacotenco
convento-y-parroquia-de-santa-ana-tlacot.description: The Convento y Parroquia de Santa Ana Tlacotenco dates from the colonial period (17th century). It is located in the borough Milpa Alta, Mexico City.

parroquia-y-claustro-de-san-antonio-teco.title: Parroquia y Claustro de San Antonio Tecómitl
parroquia-y-claustro-de-san-antonio-teco.description: The Parroquia and Claustro San Antonio Tecómitl dates from the XVI century. Every June 13th and 14th, it receives several visitors that celebrates the San Antonio's religious festivities. It was declared a cultural heritage of Mexico City.

ex-convento-y-parroquia-de-san-andres-ap.title: Ex Convento y Parroquia de San Andrés Apóstol Mixquic
ex-convento-y-parroquia-de-san-andres-ap.description: The temple and ex-convent of San Andrés Apostle Míxquic is a religious architectural complex located in San Andrés Míxquic. The building was declared a historical monument in 1932. Also it is among the properties inscribed in the Catalogue of Historical Monuments of the National Institute of Anthropology and History (INAH) of Mexico. This polygon is part of the "chinampas" area declared a World Heritage Site by Unesco.

exconvento-y-parroquia-de-san-miguel-arc.title: Exconvento y Parroquia de San Miguel Arcángel, Ixmiquilpan
exconvento-y-parroquia-de-san-miguel-arc.description: Santuario de Mapethé set the cultural and religious style of the region since the XVIII century. It shows the typical temples of the XVI century up in the dynamism of the Mexican Baroque.

templo-de-san-pedro-apostol-tlahuac.title: Templo de San Pedro Apóstol - Tlahuac
templo-de-san-pedro-apostol-tlahuac.description: The Temple of San Pedro Apóstol - Tláhuac is a religious building which is located in San Pedro Tláhuac. It was declared a historic monument on February 19, 1932 by the INAH and is located within the area of historical monuments of Xochimilco, Milpa Alta and Tláhuac.

iglesia-y-exconvento-de-san-bernardino-t.title: Iglesia y Exconvento de San Bernardino, Tepeapulco
iglesia-y-exconvento-de-san-bernardino-t.description: The Church and Ex-Convent of San Bernardino is founded on a Teocalli (Nahuatl: "God-house") by the order of the Franciscans in 1528. It is located in the town of Tepeapulco, Hidalgo.

iglesia-de-santiago-apostol-tequila.title: Iglesia de Santiago Apóstol, Tequila
iglesia-de-santiago-apostol-tequila.description: The Iglesia de Santiago Apóstol was built in the XVII century, it is located in downtown Tequila, Jalisco.

ermita-del-calvario-san-lorenzo-tlacomul.title: Ermita del Calvario, San Lorenzo Tlacomulco
ermita-del-calvario-san-lorenzo-tlacomul.description: It was built in the XVI and XVII centuries, it is a very significant place since this is the tomb of the last Tlatoanis. The chapel was built with stones from the tomb of Hueyitlahuilanque.

parroquia-de-los-tres-reyes-tetela-del-m.title: Parroquia de los Tres Reyes Tetela del Monte
parroquia-de-los-tres-reyes-tetela-del-m.description: It was built in the XVI century by the order of the Franciscans. The Capilla de los Tres Reyes Magos is located in the town of Tetela del Monte, northeast of the state of Morelos.

parroquia-del-senor-de-las-maravillas-hi.title: Parroquia del Señor de las Maravillas - Hidalgo
parroquia-del-senor-de-las-maravillas-hi.description: The church is located in the central square of the town of El Arenal in the state of Hidalgo. It is one of the most visited religious sites in the state of Hidalgo.

parroquia-de-la-purisima-concepcion-el-c.title: Parroquia de la Purísima Concepción, El Cardonal
parroquia-de-la-purisima-concepcion-el-c.description: The Parroquia de la Purísima Concepción marked the cultural and religious life of the region since the eighteenth century. It is one of the few historic religious monuments in Mexico which have reached our days almost intact. The interior of the church is decorated with Baroque style.

templo-expiatorio-de-san-diego-de-alcant.title: Templo Expiatorio de San Diego de Alcántara - Guanajuato
templo-expiatorio-de-san-diego-de-alcant.description: Built around 1663, it is considered the first monastery that existed in the Real de Minas de Guanajuato.

capilla-de-la-3er-orden-cuernavaca.title: Capilla de la 3er Orden, Cuernavaca
capilla-de-la-3er-orden-cuernavaca.description: The Tercera Orden Chapel (Capilla de la Tercera Orden), built in 1722 by Enrique de Jeres, a Franciscan monk. It is one of the chapels of the Cathedral of the Assumption of Mary of Cuernavaca.

templo-del-senor-de-villaseca-mineral-de.title: Templo del Señor de Villaseca Mineral de Cata, Guanajuato
templo-del-senor-de-villaseca-mineral-de.description: The temple was built in 1725. His style is churrigueresco and is decorated with themes from the Passion of Christ. The main altarpiece had a Baroque style, but it was replaced by a neo-classical in the XIX century.

parroquia-de-nuestra-senora-de-los-dolor.title: Parroquia de Nuestra Señora de los Dolores, Mascota
parroquia-de-nuestra-senora-de-los-dolor.description: It was built in the seventeenth century, its style is Baroque. It is located in the town of Mascota, Jalisco.

parroquia-del-sagrario-leon.title: Parroquia del Sagrario, León
parroquia-del-sagrario-leon.description: La Parroquia del Sagrario de la Diócesis de León was built in the late sixteenth century. Located in the the historic center of the city of Leon, Guanajuato.

iglesia-de-nuestra-senora-del-refugio-le.title: Iglesia de Nuestra Señora del Refugio, León
iglesia-de-nuestra-senora-del-refugio-le.description: The construction of the temple began in August 1972. The Church of Our Lady of Refuge is located on top of Cerro Gordo in León, Guanajuato.

iglesia-del-sagrado-corazon-de-jesus-y-l.title: Iglesia del Sagrado Corazón de Jesús y la Asunción de María, Apan
iglesia-del-sagrado-corazon-de-jesus-y-l.description: The Iglesia del Sagrado Corazón de Jesús y la Asunción de María is located in the central square of the town of Apan. It is the biggest tourist attraction of the town.

santuario-de-nuestra-senora-de-guadalupe.title: Santuario de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, León
santuario-de-nuestra-senora-de-guadalupe.description: Shrine of Our Lady of Guadalupe is a temple that is the symbol of the Archdiocese of Leon as well as neoclassical architecture of the city.

templo-de-belen-guanajuato-1.title: Templo de Belén, Guanajuato
templo-de-belen-guanajuato-1.description: Its construction was completed in 1775. The temple is located in the downtown area of the city of Leon, Guanajuato.

templo-del-inmaculado-corazon-de-maria-l.title: Templo del Inmaculado Corazón de María, León
templo-del-inmaculado-corazon-de-maria-l.description: The Temple of the Immaculate Heart of Mary, also known as the Immaculate Temple is a church located in the center of the city of Leon, Guanajuato. Its style is Catalan Gothic The construction began in June 1901 and was completed in 1906.

iglesia-y-convento-de-san-martin-obispo-.title: Iglesia y Convento de San Martín Obispo de Tours, Alfajayucan
iglesia-y-convento-de-san-martin-obispo-.description: It was built by the Franciscans in 1559. It is located in the town of Alfajayucan, in the state of Hidalgo.

parroquia-de-la-purisima-concepcion.title: Parroquia de la Purísima Concepción
parroquia-de-la-purisima-concepcion.description: The construction of the Parroquia de la Purísima Concepción dates from the XVII century. It is located in the town of Purisima Del Rincón, Guanajuato.

iglesia-del-senor-de-la-columna-purisima.title: Iglesia del Señor de la Columna, Purisima de Bustos
iglesia-del-senor-de-la-columna-purisima.description: The church of Señor de la Columna, Purisima de Bustos was founded on November 22 ,1855. It is located in the town of Purísima del Ricón in the state of Guanajuato.

templo-de-san-sebastian-martir-1.title: Templo de San Sebastián Mártir
templo-de-san-sebastian-martir-1.description: The first construction of the Church of San Sebastián Martir took place towards the end of 18th Century by Augustinian Friars. It is located in the town of San Sebastian del Oeste in the state of Jalisco.

parroquia-santa-maria-ahuacatitlan.title: Parroquia Santa María Ahuacatitlan
parroquia-santa-maria-ahuacatitlan.description: The Parroquia Santa María Ahuacatitlan was built before the Cathedral of Cuernavaca, circa 1525, the arrival of Franciscan missionaries . It is located in the village of Santa María Ahuacatitlán, Morelos.

iglesia-san-agustin-ohtenco.title: Iglesia San Agustin Ohtenco
iglesia-san-agustin-ohtenco.description: The Iglesia San Agustin Ohtenco is located in the town of San Agustin Ohtenco considered the smallest community in the Federal District of Mexico City. It was built during the colonial period in the 16th century.

iglesia-el-calvario.title: Iglesia El Calvario
iglesia-el-calvario.description: The Calvario Church is from the 17th century. It was remodeled in Gothic Revival architecture at the beginning of the 19th century. It is located in the City of Chiapa de Corzo, in the neighborhood of San Pedro.

iglesia-de-san-sebastian.title: Iglesia de San Sebastián
iglesia-de-san-sebastian.description: San Sebastian is a church in ruins located on the San Gregorio hill in the town Chiapa de Corzo. It was constructed in the 17th century.

iglesia-santo-domingo-de-guzman.title: Iglesia Santo Domingo de Guzman
iglesia-santo-domingo-de-guzman.description: The Santo Domingo church is the largest structure in the town. It is locally known as the “Iglesia Grande” or Big Church. The structure was built in the second half of the 16th century. It is located in the town of Chiapa de Corzo, Chiapas.

parent.title: Mexico Emblematic Churches
parent.description: Churches all over Mexico are known for their displays of culture, art and traditions. Some of these emblematic buildings are over 400 years old. The most symbolic churches in the country are the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe and Mexico City Metropolitan Cathedral.
